fields.name: What is it?
fields.value: Plankalkul was the first complete high-level language. It was designed in the 1940s, with the first concept being published in 1948. It was created by German Engineer, Konrad Zuse for his Z3 computer.

fields.name: Advantages
fields.value:
- Programs are reuseable functions
- Variables are local to functions
- The funamental data types are arrays and tuples of arrays but there are also floating point, fixed point, complex numbers; hierarchical data structures; list of pairs
- The type of the variables does not need to be declared in special header
- There is no GOTO construct
- Assignment operation
- Conditional statements
- Possibly for defining sub-programs
- Possibly for defining repition of statements, WHILE construct for iteration
- Logical operations
- Arithmetic exception handling
